SUMMARY: EbgR (for evolved β-galactosidase repressor) negatively regulates genes involved in evolved β-galactosidase system, which constitutes an alternative for lactose utilization in cells with mutations on lacZ gene [3939708, 10234816]. wild-type Ebg enzyme, encoded by ebg operon, is not efficient enough to permit growth on lactose. Mutations in ebgR and ebgA, however, enhance its catalytic activity and enable rapid growth on lactose as a sole carbon source [3939708, 10234816]. EbgR belongs to GalR-LacI family of transcriptional regulators. re is strong evidence that ebg and lac operons share a common origin in evolution [3939708]. EbgR diverged from or repressors shortly after divergence of Gram positive from Gram negative eubacteria, approximately 2.2 billion years ago [12868605]. Reviews: [10234816, 12868605].
